thread.title: e-court fee soon: CJ

author: tribuneindia.com
title: e-court fee soon: CJ
text:
Legal Correspondent
Shimla, October 11
Video-conferencing has been started in all headquarters of 11 civil and sessions divisions. This was stated by Chief Justice Mansoor Ahmad Mir during a programme organised by the HP State Legal Services Authority on environmental and afforestation. Talking about computerisation, he said the process of introducing e-court fee and e-stamping in the High Court and district courts was in its final stages. Around 130 new laptops have been provided to all judicial officers under the e-project. Justice Mir said law suit software had been provided to all judges of the High Court. On e-functioning of the High Court, he said information and objections related to court cases were being provided through e-mails to advocates. The SMS service has been started in 10 court complexes, except in Shimla. He said the computer branch of the High Court had prepared a mobile application which would provide many facilities to the advocates and litigants. Para legal volunteers are being trained to aware people about their legal rights. In September, the State Legal Services Authority organised a state meet of para legal volunteers and a conference on mediation. He said work on the new judicial academy complex was in full swing. So far, an amount of Rs 18 crore has been spent on the project. Work on national law university is also under way.
